result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Larue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

No contact with Target.  No contact with R. Bonich or J. Schreiber.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.

  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
from Department of Corrections

Defendant James L Larue in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statements by defendant.

Court orders the following:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with Target.  No contact with R. Bonich or J. Schreiber.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  
CONDITION TIME: 30 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.
